meanings.definition: The upper part of a ship's hull above the waterline.
meanings.sent1: The topsides of the boat gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The crew painted the topsides of the ship to protect it from rust.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the topsides of the vessel, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the topsides of a ship, always visible and bright.
meanings.sent5: The topsides of the ship towered above the waves, a beacon of safety.

meanings.definition: The uppermost part of a structure or object.
meanings.sent1: The topsides of the building were painted a vibrant red.
meanings.sent2: He placed the toolbox on the topsides of the workbench.
meanings.sent3: The cat climbed to the topsides of the tree and refused to come down.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed from the topsides of the hill, filling the valley.
meanings.sent5: The topsides of the mountain were covered in a blanket of snow, glistening in the sun.

meanings.definition: The side of a ship above the waterline.
meanings.sent1: The sailors stood on the topsides, scanning the horizon for land.
meanings.sent2: The captain ordered the crew to scrub the topsides of the ship.
meanings.sent3: The topsides of the vessel were painted a bright blue, standing out against the sea.
meanings.sent4: Her voice carried over the topsides of the ship, reaching every corner.
meanings.sent5: The topsides of the ship creaked as it rocked gently in the harbor.
